awd_titl_txt: Contemporary Calculus and Precalculus Lead Teacher          Development
awd_abstract_narration: North Carolina School of Science and Mathematics (NCSSM) is                     offering a four year program to create a network of twenty-five                 pairs of high school lead teachers from across the nation to                    disseminate exemplary materials in precalculus and calculus                     developed by the NCSSM faculty.  The participants will attend a                 series of residential summer workshops and will return for                      progressively more advanced curricular work and leadership training             over the course of three summers.  During the school year they will             be supported with an annual conference, a quarterly newsletter, and             on-line conferencing, and thee teams will share the new concepts                and materials with other teachers in their regions.                                                                                                             Non-NSF sources will provide cost sharing of 24% of the award.
org_div_long_name: Division of Research on Learning in Formal and Informal Settings (DRL)
